root.name: Monster Hunter Frontier
root.description: ReleaseThe game was released for the Xbox 360 in Japan on June 24, 2010. There are currently no plans to release it in North America or Europe. The game was originally released in Japan on the PC on June 21, 2007.On May 23, 2012, Microsoft has bundled the game with Halo Reach, Gears of War 2, and Fable III download codes in a "value bundle" for the Japanese market.DevelopmentThe game received a fair amount of upgrades and changes from its handheld predecessors:Guild features were expandedThe Hunter Rank (HR) was raised to 999Regular patches would add/update weapons, armor, and itemsPlayers were given the ability to customize their houses by purchasing or crafting ornaments and furniture for decorationWeapon and armor paths were alteredNew monsters were addedNew monsters included:Espinas (plant like wyverns)Akura Vushima (crystal scorpion)Berukuros (thunder phoenix)Pariapuria (aquatic pseudowyvern)Kamu Orugaron (canine)Nono Orugaron (canine)Raviente (snake)
